intro: Medinilla leytensis, commonly known as the Leyte Medinilla, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has elliptical, glossy leaves and produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
